meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a co-heir with others.
meanings.sent1: In the parcenary, siblings shared the inheritance equally.
meanings.sent2: The parcenary of cousins inherited the family farm.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, the parcenary of aunts and uncles argued over who got Grandma's jewelry.
meanings.sent4: The parcenary of friends split the lottery winnings among themselves.
meanings.sent5: The parcenary of classmates worked together to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: A group of co-heirs who inherit property together.
meanings.sent1: The parcenary gathered to discuss the division of the estate.
meanings.sent2: In the parcenary, each member had a share of the land.
meanings.sent3: The parcenary of cousins decided to sell the inherited house and split the money.
meanings.sent4: The parcenary of siblings stood united in their decision to keep the family business running.
meanings.sent5: The parcenary of neighbors celebrated their joint ownership of the community garden.
